representatives.name: Peter Roskam
representatives.quote: However well-intentioned, Obamacare failed the American people. Illinois families are paying more money for fewer and fewer benefits. Insurance premiums have increased by an average of over 21%. Last year, the Land of Lincoln co-op became the 16th in the country to collapse, leaving 49,000 Illinoisans without any healthcare coverage at all and taxpayers on for hook for over $160 million. We’re committed to an open and transparent process as we debate this legislation.

representatives.name: Rodney Davis
representatives.quote: Some members, from both parties, may not want to face the mess that Obamacare has created and what is required to clean it up, but we made a promise to the American people to responsibly fix our health care system and that’s what this bill does.

representatives.name: John Shimkus
representatives.quote: This is the relief my constituents have demanded. The American Health Care Act offers American families more options, lower costs and the flexibility to choose a plan that fits their unique needs, not Washington’s one-size-fits-all mandates

representatives.name: Tammy Duckworth
representatives.quote: I'm frustrated that the best plan they came up with would result in working people receiving less coverage and paying more for it.

representatives.name: Richard Durbin
representatives.quote: With this reckless bill, Republicans have shown us that the only thing they are serious about is cutting taxes for the wealthy, increasing out-of-pocket costs for middle-class families and seniors, and throwing people off their health insurance plans.

representatives.name: Robin Kelly
representatives.quote: The Affordable Care Act has left behind a legacy of progress. It is working and is more popular than ever. Let's fix any issues instead of passing this bill that will make Americans sick again.

representatives.name: Bobby Rush
representatives.quote: Statement not collected.

representatives.name: Dan Lipinski
representatives.quote: Statement not collected.

representatives.name: Danny K. Davis
representatives.quote: Statement not collected.

representatives.name: Doug LaMalfa
representatives.quote: Middle income families in the north state have been pleading to our office for relief from the drastic effects of this law; such as significantly higher premiums and deductibles coupled with the loss of their original plan and doctor.

representatives.name: Tom McClintock
representatives.quote: My motion to request that additional resources be focused to assure access for (older, low-income workers) passed the House Budget Committee on a bipartisan vote, and I am grateful that House leadership worked with my office over the weekend to set these changes in motion in the manager's amendment. With this, I will support passage of this bill to the Senate.

representatives.name: Kevin McCarthy
representatives.quote: Our three-phase approach will build a better, patient-centered health system.

representatives.name: Steve Chabot
representatives.quote: Repealing and replacing Obamacare is going to be a complicated, multi-step process. The legislation introduced this week begins the process by taking control away from federal bureaucrats and returning health care decisions to patients and their doctors. I expect that changes to improve the legislation will be made as it works its way through Congress, and I hope to be able to support the legislation in its final form.

representatives.name: Bill Johnson
representatives.quote: I am a supporter of the bill.

representatives.name: Patrick J. Tiberi
representatives.quote: The American Health Care Act is our plan to repeal Obamacare and replace it with a 21st century system that gives people better access to quality and affordable health care. It contains specific reforms to provide relief from Obamacare’s taxes and mandates, and gives patients the tools they need to be in charge of their own care, like increased access to health savings accounts and tax credits to help individuals and families purchase the care they need.

representatives.name: Sherrod Brown
representatives.quote: This plan will raise prices for Ohioans – particularly older Ohioans – and kick people off of the coverage they have today. It will threaten jobs across our state by cutting funding for local hospitals that employ hundreds of thousands of Ohioans. This plan does nothing to lower healthcare costs for Ohioans, but hands a huge tax break to drug companies and insurance executives who jack up their prices.

representatives.name: Joyce Beatty
representatives.quote: Republicans have had seven years to develop their own comprehensive healthcare plan. Yet, they have failed to deliver a workable plan—even conceding that their new bill is a 'work in progress.' That being said, it is painfully obvious that 'Republicancare' is going to be a prescription for disaster for our seniors, women, people with disabilities, the sick and countless working families.

representatives.name: Jim Jordan
representatives.quote: We’ve had meetings with the vice president, with the secretary, with the budget director and with the president, himself. I appreciate that fact. I just think that the speaker’s plan, it doesn’t accomplish what the voters sent us here to accomplish. That is why we are opposed to it.

representatives.name: Warren Davidson
representatives.quote: If we called the votes today, I would be a ‘no,’ as would a lot of other people in the Congress today.

representatives.name: Robert E. Latta
representatives.quote: Statement not collected.

representatives.name: Bob Gibbs
representatives.quote: Statement not collected.

representatives.name: Dianne Feinstein
representatives.quote: The Republican health care plan would devastate California & leave millions without health insurance. I strongly oppose it.

representatives.name: Jerry McNerney
representatives.quote: If you're a family living paycheck to paycheck, you have a lot to be afraid of. You will either pay more for less coverage or you will lose coverage altogether.
